# Statistical Modelling Practicals
## Practical 1:


```{R Practial_1}
#Testing R
#Practical sheet 1

#1. 
#First generate a load of nomrmal random numbers
x=  rnorm(10000, mean=0, sd=1)
#Y the truth value of them being greater than or eq to 1 
y <- x >= 1
z = x*y 
#We wish to find the expectation of normals given >=1, so take mean of z
mean_estimate = sum(z)/sum(y)
print(mean_estimate)

#Then we can estimate the E(Z^6) also
sixth_moment = x^2
moment_estimate = mean(sixth_moment)

print(moment_estimate)





#Quesiton 2 
#Want the upper 5% point of the chi_6^2 distrib. 
#Well we can use the qchisquared function. 6 degrees of freedom.
print(qchisq(0.95,6))

#Quesiton 3 - next we solve some bits and bobs

A <- t(matrix(c(3,4,-2,1, 2, -1, 7 ,-2, 6 , 2, -1, 1, 1, 6, -2 ,5),4,4))
b <-  c(9,13,11,27)


x <- solve(A,b)
print(x)
```
